1. Grand Socco Market: In addition to street food, this bustling market is also a great place to shop for textiles, spices, pottery, and other traditional Moroccan souvenirs. 2. Marshan District: This neighborhood is known for its high-end boutiques and furniture shops, where you can find high-quality Moroccan textiles, rugs, and home décor items. 3. Rue de la Kasbah: This street is lined with shops selling a variety of Moroccan handicrafts, including textiles, pottery, jewelry, and leather goods. 4. Petit Socco: In this small square, you can find many souvenir shops and boutiques that offer traditional Moroccan textiles and pottery. 5. The Hillawi House: This is a popular boutique that offers a range of high-quality Moroccan textiles, including silk scarves, rugs, and blankets. When shopping for textiles and pottery in Tangier, make sure to negotiate with the vendors to get the best price possible. Additionally, some vendors may overcharge tourists, so be aware of the market value of different items before making a purchase.
